ipxact:component.ipxact:name: CAN_FD_IP_Core

ipxact:memoryMap.ipxact:name: CAN_FD_registers
ipxact:memoryMap.ipxact:description: Register map for CAN FD IP Core

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: DEVICE_ID
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: The register contains an identifer of CAN FD IP function. It is used to determine whether CAN IP function is mapped correctly on its base address.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: DEVICE_ID
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Device ID

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: MODE
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: MODE register sets special operating modes of the controller. All bits are active in logic 1.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RST
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Activating this bit resets the controller. It has the same effect as logic 0 on res_n input of controller

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: STM
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Self test mode. In this mode transmitted frame is considered valid even if acknowledge is not received.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: AFM
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Acceptance filters mode. Activating this bit enables usage of acceptance filters. If disabled, every received frame is stored in the RX buffer.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FDE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enable flexible data rate support. When this bit is inactive, receiving recessive EDL bit (Flexible data rate frame) causes Form error.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LOM
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Listen only mode. In this mode controller only receives data and sends only recessive bits on the bus. When a dominant bus is sent it is rerouted internally so that bus value remains the same. Note that when this mode is enabled controller will not transmit any inserted frame!

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TSM
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Triple sampling mode. Bus value is sampled three times when this bit is active. Even if this bit is set, triple sampling is used only during Nominal data rate. It is recommended to use triple sampling only at low Bit rates.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RTRP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: RTR Frame preferred behavior. When RTR frame is sent non-zero dlc code can be inserted. This bit specifies the behavior of controller when this situation happens. If the bit is active then all zeros are sent and inserted dlc is ignored. If a bit is inactive then inserted dlc is sent.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ACF
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When this bit is active acknowledge is not sent even when received CRC matches the calculated one.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: COMMAND
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Writing logic 1 gives a command to the controller. The meaning of command is different for every bit. This register is automatically erased when a command is finished.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: AT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Writing logic 1 into this bit aborts actual transmission or reception

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RRB
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Release Receive buffer. Writing logic 1 deletes all data from the Receive buffer.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CDO
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Clear data overrun flag. Writing logic 1 will clear overrun flag.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: STATUS
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Register signals various states of CAN controller which are not mutually exclusive. Every bit is active in logic 1.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RBS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Active value of this bit means Receive buffer is not empty.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TBS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: TXT buffer status. Active value of this bit means both TXT buffers are full and frame can not be inserted for transmission

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: DOS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Data overrun status (flag). An active value of this bit signals frame was lost due to not enough space in the Receive buffer.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ET
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Active value of this bit means that Error frame is beeing transmitted.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Active value of this bit signals that controller is receiving a frame.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Active value of this bit signals that controller is transmitting a frame.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ES
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Error status. Active value signals that error warning limit was reached at any of error counters

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: BS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Bus status. Active value signals that bus is idle, the controller is integrating or bus off. Therefore this bit is active when there is no activity on the bus.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: SETTINGS
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Register with enable bit of the controller.The configuration of retransmission limit for failed frames is also located in this register. Furthermore configuration of ISO FD CAN or CAN FD 1.0 is done here. Every bit is active in logic 1.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RTRLE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Active value means that limit of retransmission is enabled.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RTR_TH
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The maximal amount of retransmission attempts

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: INT_LOOP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Active value in this bit means that internal loop-back option is permanently enabled (used only for testing).

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ENA
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Active value means that the CAN FD controller is enabled.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FD_TYPE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Selection between two possible CAN FD frame formats (0 ISO CAN FD, 1 CAN FD 1.0)

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: INT
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register contains interrupt vector of interrupts that were generated since the last read. If 8 bit or 16 bit access is executed to any of lowest two bits the register is automatically erased.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: INT_ENA
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Register enables interrupts by different sources. Logic 1 in each bit means interrupt is allowed

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: EIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Error warning limit reached interrupt enable

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: DOIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Data Overrun interrupt enable

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: EPIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Node became error passive or bus off interrupt enable

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ALIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Arbitration lost interrupt enable

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Frame successfully received interrupt enable

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: BEIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Bus Error interrupt enable

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LFIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Event logging interrupt enable

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RFIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Receive buffer full interrupt enable

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: BSIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Bit-rate shifted interrupt enable

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Frame successfully transmitted interrupt enable

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: BTR_FD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Length of bit time segments for Data bit time in Time quanta. Note that SYNC segment always lasts one Time quanta.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PH2_FD
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Phase 2 segment

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PROP_FD
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Propagation segment

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PH1_FD
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Phase 1 segment

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: BTR
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: The length of bit time segments for Nominal bit time in Time quanta. Note that SYNC segment always lasts one Time quanta.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PROP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Propagation segment

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PH1
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Phase 1 segment

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PH2
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Phase 2 segment

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ALC
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Arbitration lost capture value

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ALC_VAL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Arbitration lost capture value.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: SJW
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Synchronisation jump width registers for both Nominal and Data bit times.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SJW
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Synchronisation jump width in Nominal bit time.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SJW_FD
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Synchronisation jump widh in Data bit time.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: BRP
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Baud rate Prescaler register for Nominal bit time. Specifies time quanta duration.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: BRP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Baud-Rate Prescaler

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: BRP_FD
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Baud rate Prescaler register for Data bit time. Specifies time quanta duration.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: BRP_FD
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Baud rate Prescaler FD

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: EWL
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Error warning limit register. If an error warning limit is reached interrupt can be called. Error warning limit indicates heavily disturbed bus. Note that according to CAN specification this value is fixed at 96 and should not be configurable! The configuration of this value is one of the extra features of this IP Core.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: EWL_LIMIT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Error warning limit

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ERP
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Error passive limit. When one of error counters (RXC/TXC) exceeds this value, it changes Fault confinement state to error passive. Note that according to CAN specification this value is fixed at 128 and should not be configurable! The configuration of this value is one of the extra features of this IP Core. Note that IP Core always turns to bus_off state once any error counter reaches 255!

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ERP_LIMIT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Error passive limit

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: FAULT_STATE
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Fault confinement state of the node. This state can be manipulated by writing into registers RXC/TXC and ERP_LIMIT of ERP register. When these counters are set Fault confinement state changes automatically.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ERP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Error passive

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: BOF
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Bus off

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ERA
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Error active

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: FILTER_A_VAL
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Bit value for acceptance filters. Filters A, B, C are available. The identifier format is the same as transmitted and received identifier format. BASE Identifier is 11 LSB and Identifier extension are bits 28-12! Note that filter support is available by default but it can be left out from synthesis (to save logic) by setting "sup_fillt=false". If the particular filter is not supported, writes to this register have no effect and read will return all zeroes.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: BIT_VAL_A_VAL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Bit Value for acceptance filters to be compared with income identifier. Only bits set in according to FILTER_X_MASK register are compared.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: FILTER_STATUS
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register provides information about whether the Core is synthesized with fillter support.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SUP_FILTA
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Is logic 1 when the Core was synthesized with "sup_filtA = true" Otherwise is logic 0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SUP_FILTB
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Is logic 1 when the Core was synthesized with "sup_filtB = true" Otherwise is logic 0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SUP_RANGE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Is logic 1 when the Core was synthesized with "sup_range = true" Otherwise is logic 0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SUP_FILTC
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Is logic 1 when the Core was synthesized with "sup_filtC = true" Otherwise is logic 0.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: RX_MF
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Number of free (32 bit) words in RX Buffer

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: RX_MC
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Register with number of frames in the receive buffer.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RX_MC_VALUE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Receive buffer frame count value

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: TX_SETTINGS
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register controls the access into TX buffers. All bits are active in logic 1.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TXT1_ALLOW
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Allow transmitting frames from TXT buffer 1. Content of TX Buffer1 is validated by 0 to 1 transition on these bits.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TXT2_ALLOW
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Allow transmitting frames from TXT buffer 2. Content of TX Buffer2 is validated by 0 to 1 transition on these bits.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: BUF_DIR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Buffer to which the transmit data should be stored. To insert data for transmission first set TXTX_ALLOW to 0, then set BUF_DIR to select TXT_BUFFER buffer. As next write the data into buffer by executing accesses into TX_DATA_X registers. As last step, validate the content of the buffer by setting TXTX_ALLOW to 1. TXT_1_EMPTY bit of TX_STAT register is automatically cleared by this action.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FRAME_SWAP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If frame is inserted into either TXT buffer and the other TXT buffer is empty, the frame in the first buffer is transmitted. However, if during the transmission of this frame another frame is inserted into the other TXT buffer and error occurs (or arbitration is lost) there are two frames which can be selected for transmission (assuming Timestamps of both frames are lower than external Timestamp) . If FRAME_SWAP bit is set to 0 the frame which was transmitted last is rettransmitted. If FRAME_SWAP is set to 1 the frame for transmission is selected as if both frames were inserted for its first transmission as explained in Section "Transmitt frame selection".

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: LOG_TRIG_CONFIG
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Register for configuration of event logging triggering conditions. If Event logger is in Ready state and any of triggering conditions appear it starts recording the events on the bus (moves to Running state). Logic 1 in each bit means this triggering condition is valid.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: T_SOF
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trigger on Start of frame field appears

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: T_ARBL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trigger on arbitration was lost

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: T_TRV
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trigger on valid frame transmitted.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: T_REV
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trigger on valid frame received

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: T_ERPC
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trigger on Fault confinement state changed

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: T_OVL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trigger when Overload frame is transmitted

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: T_ERR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trigger on error appeared

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: T_BRS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trigger when bit rate is shifted

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: T_TRS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trigger when the unit starts transmitting a new frame.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: T_USRW
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When logic 1 is written into this bit event logging is triggered immediately

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: T_EWLR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trigger on Error warning limit reached

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: T_ARBS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trigger on Arbitration field starts

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: T_CTRS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trigger on Control field starts

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: T_ACKNR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trigger on acknowledge not received in ACK slot

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: T_RES
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trigger when the unit starts receiving a new frame

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: T_ACKR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trigger on acknowledge received in ACK slot

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: T_DATS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trigger on Data field starts

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: T_CRCS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trigger on CRC field starts

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LOG_WPP_VAL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Logger write pointer position

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: LOG_STATUS
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Status register for Event logger.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LOG_CFG
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Event logger is in Config state

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LOG_RDY
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Event logger is in Ready state

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LOG_RUN
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Event logger is in Running state

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LOG_EXIST
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Information whether event logger is synthesized in the circuit.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LOG_SIZE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Size of event logger. This information is valid only if logger is synthesized! (generic "use_logger")

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: LOG_CAPT_EVENT_2
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Second word of the logged event details.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: EVENT_TS_15_0
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Bits 15 to 0 of timestamp when the event occurred.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: EVENT_DETAILS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Details of the event which appeared. Refer to 8 for bit meanings.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: EVENT_TYPE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Type of the event which was captured. Refer to 8 for bit meanings

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: DOR_EVNT
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Data overrun appeared on RX Frame

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: ACKNR_EVNT
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Acknowledge was not received in ACK Slot

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: LOG_CAPT_EVENT_1
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: First word of the logged event details.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: EVENT_TIME_STAMP_47_TO_16
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Bits 47 to 16 of timestamp when the event occurred. MSB 16 bits from 64-bit time

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: YOLO_REG
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Register for fun :)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: YOLO_VAL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: What else could be in this register??

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: DEBUG_REGISTER
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Register for reading out state of the controller. This register is only for debugging purposes!

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: STUFF_COUNT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Actual stuff count modulo 8 as definned in ISO FD protocol. Stuff count is erased in the beginning of the frame and increased by one with each stuff bit until STUFF count field in ISO FD CRC. Then it stays fixed until the beginning of next frame. In non-ISO FD or normal CAN stuff bits are counted until the end of a frame. Note that this field is NOT gray encoded as defined in ISO FD standard. Stuff count is calculated only as long as controller is transceiving on the bus. During the reception this value remains fixed!

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: DESTUFF_COUNT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Actual de-stuff count modulo 8 as defined in ISO FD protocol. De-Stuff count is erased in the beginning of the frame and increased by one with each de-stuffed bit until STUFF count field in ISO FD CRC. Then it stays fixed until beginning of next frame. In non-ISO FD or normal CAN de-stuff bits are counted until the end of the frame. Note that this field is NOT grey encoded as defined in ISO FD standard. De-stuff count is calculated in both. Transceiver as well as receiver.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PC_ARB
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Protocol control State machine is in Arbitration field.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PC_CON
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Protocol control State machine is in Control field.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PC_DAT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Protocol control State machine is in Data field.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PC_CRC
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Protocol control State machine is in CRC field.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PC_EOF
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Protocol control State machine is in End of file field.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PC_OVR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Protocol control State machine is in Overload field.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PC_INT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Protocol control State machine is in Interrupt field.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: LOG_COMMAND
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Register for controlling the state machine of Event logger and read pointer position. Every bit is active in logic 1.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LOG_STR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Start event logging. Move from Config State to Ready state. Has no effect in Ready state or Running state.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LOG_ABT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Abort event logging. Move from Ready State or Running State to Config State.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LOG_UP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Move read pointer one position up.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LOG_DOWN
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Move read pointer one position down.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: LOG_RPP_VAL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Logger read pointer position

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: LOG_CAPT_CONFIG
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Register for configuring which events to capture by event logger into the logger FIFO memory when event logger is running.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C_SOF
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capture when Start of frame field appears.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C_ARBL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capture when arbitration was lost.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C_REV
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capture when valid frame received.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C_TRV
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capture when valid frame transmitted.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C_OVL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capture when overload appeared.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C_DESTUFF
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capture when received bit is de-stuffed (receiver and transceiver, one fixed stuff bit before CRC sequence is not captured).

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C_ERR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capture when error appeared.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C_BRS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capture when bit rate is shifted.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C_STUFF
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capture when Stuff bit was inserted (transceiver only, one fixed stuf bit before CRC sequence is not captured)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C_SYNE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capture when synchronization edge was detected (recessive to dominant edge).

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C_RES
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capture when receive of frame started.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C_ACKNR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capture when Acknowledge was not received in ACK Slot.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C_OVR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capture data overrun

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C_EWLR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capture when Error warning limit is reached.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C_ARBS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capture when Arbitration field is started.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C_CTRS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capture when Control field starts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C_ERC
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capture when Fault confinement state is changed.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C_DATS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capture when Data field starts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C_ACKR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capture when Acknowledge was received in ACK Slot.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C_TRS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capture when the unit starts transmitting

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: C_CRCS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Capture when CRC field starts.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: TX_COUNTER
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Counter for transmitted frames to enable bus traffic measurement

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TX_COUNTER_VAL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Counter for transcieved frames to enable bus traffic measurement.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: RX_COUNTER
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Counter for received frames to enable bus traffic measurement

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RX_COUNTER_VAL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Counter for received frames to enable bus traffic measurement

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ERR_CAPT
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Last error frame capture.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ERR_POS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Position of the last error.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: ERC_POS_ACK
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Error in Acknowledge field or CRC delimiter

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ERR_TYPE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Type of the last error

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: TX_STATUS
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Status of the TXT Buffers

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TXT2_EMPTY
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Active when Transmit buffer 2 is empty.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TXT1_EMPTY
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Active when Transmit buffer 1 is empty.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TX_TIME_SUPPORT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit is has value of logic 1 if the core was synthesized wih "tx_time_support=true". Otherwise this bit is 0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TRV_DELAY_VALUE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When sending CAN FD Frame with bit rate shift, transceiver delay is measured to apply secondary sampling point for bit error detection during transmission. After the measurement is done (after EDL bit) it can be read from this register. The value in this register is valid until the start of the next frame. It is recommended to set bit rate shift interrupt and read this value directly after bit rate is shifted in interrupt handling. This register can be used for transceiver TXD to RXD delay verifcation.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: RX_DATA
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: The recieve buffer data at read pointer position in FIFO. CAN Frame layout in RX buffer is described in Figure 7. By reading data from this register read_pointer is automatically increased, as long as there is next data word stored in the buffer. Next Read from this register returns next word of CAN frame. First stored word in the buffer is FRAME_FORM, next TIMESTAMP_U etc. In detail bits of each word have following meaning. If any access is executed (8 bit, 16 bit or 32 bit), the read_pointer automatically increases. It is recomended to use 32 bit acccess on this register.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: RX_RPP
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Read pointer position in th Receive buffer. When a new frame is stored write pointer is increased accordingly.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RX_RPP_VAL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Read pointer position in the Receive buffer. When RX_DATA register is read, read pointer is increased accordingly

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: RX_WPP
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Write pointer position in th Receive buffer. When a new frame is stored write pointer is increased

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RX_WPP_VALUE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Write pointer position in th Receive buffer. When a new frame is stored write pointer is increased

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: RX_BUFF_SIZE
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Size of th Receive buffer. This parameter is configurable before synthesis.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RX_BUFF_SIZE_VALUE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Size of th Receive buffer. This parameter is configurable before synthesis.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: RX_STATUS
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Information register one about FIFO Receive buffer.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RX_EMPTY
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Receive buffer is empty.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RX_FULL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Receive buffer is full.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: FILTER_CONTROL
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Every filter can be set to accept only selected frame types. Every bit active in logic 1.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FILT_A_BASIC
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If CAN Basic Frame should be accepted by filter A.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FILT_A_FD_BAS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If FD CAN Basic Frame should be accepted by filter A

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FILT_A_EXT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If CAN Extended Frame should be accepted by Filter A

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FILT_A_FD_EXT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If CAN FD Extended Frame should be accepted by filter A

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FILT_B_BASIC
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If CAN Basic Frame should be accepted by filter B.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FILT_B_EXT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If CAN Extended Frame should be accepted by Filter B

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FILT_B_FD_BAS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If FD CAN Basic Frame should be accepted by filter B

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FILT_B_FD_EXT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If CAN FD Extended Frame should be accepted by filter B.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FILT_C_BASIC
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If CAN Basic Frame should be accepted by filter C.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FILT_C_EXT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If CAN Extended Frame should be accepted by Filter C

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FILT_C_FD_BAS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If FD CAN Basic Frame should be accepted by filter C

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FILT_RANGE_FD_EXT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If CAN FD Extended Frame should be accepted by Range filter

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FILT_RANGE_FD_BAS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If FD CAN Basic Frame should be accepted by Range filter

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FILT_RANGE_EXT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If CAN Extended Frame should be accepted by Range filter

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FILT_RANGE_BASIC
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If CAN Basic Frame should be accepted by Range filter

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FILT_C_FD_EXT
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: If CAN FD Extended Frame should be accepted by filter C.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: FILTER_RAN_HIGH
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Higher threshold of the Range filter. Note that 29-bit value of range threshold is not the same format as transmitted

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: FILTER_RAN_LOW
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Lower threshold of the Range filter. Note that 29-bit value of range threshold is not the same format as transmitted and received identifier! In TX_DATA_4 (transmitted identifier) BASE Identifier is at 11 LSB bits and Extension at bits 28-12. However, actual decimal value of the Identifier is that BASE identifier is at MSB bits and 18 LSB bits is identifier extension. The unsigned binary value of the identifier must be written into this register! Note that filter support is available by default but it can be left out from synthesis (to save logic) by setting "sup_ran=false". If the particular filter is not supported, writes to this register have no effect and read will return all zeroes.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: BIT_RAN_LOW_VAL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Low threshold value

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: FILTER_C_VAL
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Bit value for acceptance filters. Filters A, B, C are available. The identifier format is the same as transmitted and

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: FILTER_C_MASK
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Bit mask for acceptance filters. Filters A, B, C are available. The identifier format is the same as transmitted and

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: BIT_MASK_C_VAL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Bit mask for acceptance filters. Logic 1 indicates this bit of Income identifier is compared with the same bit in FILTER_X_VALUE. Logic 0 indicates this bit is not compared.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: FILTER_B_VAL
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Bit value for acceptance filters. Filters A, B, C are available. The identifier format is the same as transmitted and

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: FILTER_B_MASK
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Bit mask for acceptance filters. Filters A, B, C are available. The identifier format is the same as transmitted and

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: BIT_MASK_B_VAL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Bit mask for acceptance filters. Logic 1 indicates this bit of Income identifier is compared with the same bit in FILTER_X_VALUE. Logic 0 indicates this bit is not compared.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: FILTER_A_MASK
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Bit mask for acceptance filters. Filters A, B, C are available. The identifier format is the same as transmitted and received identifier format. BASE Identifier is 11 LSB and Identifier extension are bits 28-12! Note that filter support is available by default but it can be left out from synthesis (to save logic) by setting "sup_fillt=false". If the particular filter is not supported, writes to this register have no effect and read will return all zeroes.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: BIT_MASK_A_VAL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Bit mask for acceptance filters. Logic 1 indicates this bit of Income identifier is compared with the same bit in FILTER_X_VALUE. Logic 0 indicates this bit is not compared.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: CTR_PRES
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Register for manipulation with error counters.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: ERR_NORM
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Error counter for nominal Bit time

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ERR_NORM_VAL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Number of errors in the Nominal bit time.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: TXC
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Counter for transcieved frames to enable bus traffic measurement.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TXC_VAL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Counter for transcieved frames to enable bus traffic measurement.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: RXC
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Counter for received frames to enable bus traffic measurement.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: RXC_VAL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Receive error counter. This register determines Fault confiment state (Error active,Error passive, Bus off) according to CAN specification.

ipxact:component.ipxact:description: CAN FD IP Core from Ondrej Ille written at Czech Technical University, department of Measurement.
